titleStmt.title: A divine cordiall for a devout soule Composed out of a serious discourse upon sinne against the Holy Ghost: as it was laid open in the full nature and appendices thereof. In a sermon preached at Taunton in the county of Somerset, upon Monday, April 4. 1653. In the assize week. By William Sclater, Doctor in Divinity, now preacher of the Word of God in Broadstreet, London.
titleStmt.author: Sclater, William, 1609-1661.

titleStmt.title: A divine cordiall for a devout soule Composed out of a serious discourse upon sinne against the Holy Ghost: as it was laid open in the full nature and appendices thereof. In a sermon preached at Taunton in the county of Somerset, upon Monday, April 4. 1653. In the assize week. By William Sclater, Doctor in Divinity, now preacher of the Word of God in Broadstreet, London.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by M. Simmons, and are to be sould by William Hope at the Blew Anchor behind the Exchange,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the Union Theological Seminary, New York.
